text: Well they were partly right in the Warning label on the box, this game did provide me with shock, disbelief and confusion.. at how hard it was. I rented this game many times and never got really far, but I do remember some of the dreamy music being memorable. One of my first uploads in this list comes from this game!
author: SupraDarky

text: There is a good album with orchestral covers of this game from OCremix.
author: Matisaro

text: This game was legendary in how bullshit it was, and it didn't even have the excuse of being released on the NES. Unfortunately I don't have the old Nintendo Power that showed strategies for 7th Saga anymore.
author: David E.

text: This game's illusion of choice is what infuriated me the most. You got to pick your dude at the start but if you got paired against the robot fellow, you weren't beating the game.
author: FWaNKuS88

text: Apparently, it wasn't so hard originally. It was just made more difficult for the US release. Not sure why they considered that a good idea.
author: Viehzerrer

text: I was wondering if you were ever going to upload another song from this game. Mostly because the only song you ever uploaded from it was back in the two digits. I was also wondering if you'd upload another Chaos Legion song.
author: GenericYoutubeComment Channel

text: Oh weird! Usually it's the opposite, like with Mega Man 2 and others I can't remember right now.
author: Chris Mudd

text: http://ocremix.org/game/732/7th-saga-snes
author: Tommy Efreeti

text: 7th saga is not even remotely difficult.... you wanna play a difficult game, play Wizardry 4. I beat that game when I was 6 years old, after playing it every day after school for a year, and it still remains my biggest video game achievement in my entire life, 27 years later.
author: wowsnav

text: Myro Kratios Higher difficulty makes the game last longer and encourages more rentals. Not necessarily a bad idea anyway since the original is a bit easy (there is a translated japanese rom online for those curious), but the changes were too extreme. Leveling up and getting a single HP point just pisses you off.
author: Cresset

text: A rare case where the Japanese version was easier than the American version. From what i read, they made a mistake concerning the leveling of the other characters. The higher level you became, the more powerful the others got at an accelerating pace that you literally could not match. Masters of the game know that if they get to a certain point of the game and are matched up with a certain other character, the game was almost literally impossible to beat.
author: MrRaindog

text: this was easily one of the hardest games on the snes for rpgs but that is what made you want to keep playing. I always thought the AI characters were competing against you the entire game like a race, but really its just scripted out
author: Wild West

text: This really reminds me of the Ultima 6 opening for some reason
author: plhearn

text: This game was damn hard
author: Beau -

text: Wow this brings back memories of 100000000 random encounters.  Was there ever another game that punished you more than this one for wanting to go from point A to B to explore?
author: spaceinator73

text: I search for the name of this game's name for years because the OST was so amazing. I finally found the name last year. By far best unknown gem I heard.
author: Swaysome

text: This track provided me complete ENJOYMENT!
author: spybloom

text: Man, I love the music in this game so dang much. SO many of Enix's SNES games had killer under-appreciated soundtracks.
author: jackal27

text: Learned about this game from a good friend in college we ended up playing our own campaigns together and ended up with some crazy stories and internal jokes. Anytime I see this game featured somewhere I always get excited. Good choice.
author: Max

text: Well, that's 2046 entries between this one and the last upload of this game. I think that's a new record.
author: Beremor

text: I LOVED this game back in the day, ins spite of its difficulty.
author: BygPhattyPlus

text: Now this was a tough and awesome rpg!
author: Steven U

text: As much as I like this game... screw the stupid difficulty ramp from Japan to US :P
author: ZPokemonfanA

text:
Hard to hear this song for very long on the overworld, as the encounters are numerous and unforgiving!  What a difficult game...

Combined with the fact that the other "heroes" on the journey get max stats on every level up, and level up when you do, this game can quickly become very frustrating if you have made enemies with too many!
author: Amelyssan1

text: Such a bullshit game, haha.

text: This sounds like the kind of music that pleasant the first time you hear it but makes you want to tear your ears out when you have to hear it for a 1000th time because you got another game over.
